definition: abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
too busy/to have no time for/fully occupied
lit. too much for the eye to take in (idiom); a feast for the eyes
more than one can attend to (idiom)/deluged (with inquiries etc)/overwhelmed (by the beauty of the scenery)
to have no time (for sth)/to be too busy (to do sth)
the eye cannot take it all in (idiom); too many good things to see/a feast for the eyes
to be calm and unruffled in the midst of chaos or at a busy time (idiom)

sentences.english: Then, Hush Puppies shoes sales began to increase ceaselessly.
sentences.chinese: 於是，暇步士運動鞋的銷量開始不斷增加。

sentences.english: Hush pubbies is my favorite brand.
sentences.chinese: 暇步士是我最喜歡的品牌。

sentences.english: If the inflammation while delays until the free time department to present the sound to shout mutely.
sentences.chinese: 如果炎症趁延至暇部則出現聲音喊啞。

sentences.english: In order to practice the holy Dharma, we need to first obtain a precious human birth.
sentences.chinese: 而爲能夠修持聖法，我們首先必須獲得暇滿人身。

sentences.english: Hush puppies is my favorite brand.
sentences.chinese: 暇步士是我最喜歡的品牌。

definition: too busy/to have no time for/fully occupied
different/unique/special/very/(classical) to behead/to die/to cut off/to separate/to surpass
long or drawn out/remote in time or space/leisurely/to swing/pensive/worried
